review.title: quiet and value for money
review.reviewText: It was a value purchase.  I stayed one night as I need a place to sleep

review.title: Pricey
review.reviewText: Room was pricey. Tv didn't work and there was strands of hair on the bed and in the bathroom sink. I had to park my car (which had a trailer attached) way down the street and walk to the place. The price did not match what I got.
Mold poor ventilation in bathroom   It was very noisy from the road traffic. The location was convenient but not easy to access other services.

review.title: a place to sleep
review.reviewText: It was alright,  the bed was comfortable. Just wish that they had a coffee pot in the rooms. No wifi and if they do have it we weren't told about it.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: coffee pot in  room and the staff needs improvement
review.locationRemarks: Malls and San Francisco is close by.

review.title: This place is a dump I rather stay at Motel 6
review.reviewText: The desk clerk didn't speak much English, no screens in the bathroom window nets and Mosquitos flying in the room was not that clean.

review.title: By the freeway.
review.reviewText: Needed a cheap room quickly. I was able to book this quickly. Bed was okay, heater was good. Channels on tv were terrible. I just needed a room for the night while traveling.

review.title: Good Marin location
review.reviewText: Clean hotel and good location in Corte Madera.  Room a bit small and outside a little dirty but overall good balue
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and covenient location and good value
review.negativeRemarks: Kleenex in the rooms

review.title: A Nice Place
review.reviewText: This is a good location for us when we visit the Mill Valley area
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, good price, parking on site, nice staff & a restaurant next door
review.locationRemarks: Shopping across the street...although the freeway is adjacent, it's quiet...a short cab ride into Mill Valley where we like to go

review.title: Skip this place
review.reviewText: The key to the room assigned to me did not work, but I had to complain to the woman in the office several times before she believed me and checked it out for herself. She lacked all people skills and certainly should not be working with the public. ~ The wi-fi connection did not work, and, once again, the woman argued with me about that. She said she would show me how to access it with my laptop, which I thought was condescending; I told her I knew how to access it: the problem was that the password was wrong. Again, she argued with me, so I just gave up. ~ The toilet was broken, and I could barely get it to work.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a thorough overhaul. And the woman in the office needs to be fired.

review.title: Location was perfect for my business purpose.
review.reviewText: I had to be in San Francisco all week and I used this hotel because of its location and price.  The structure was very old and had upgrades over the years.  Still, I would call the room only adequate because of size and amenities.  Just reminded me of "old."  The wifi was cumbersome but worked.  For the price and purpose, it fit my business needs, but I would never use it for a family visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernize the facility.
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping center nearby and many interesting places to visit for business or entertainment within a short drive.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Front door was loosely constructed. Water contol in shower was set backwards- hot was cold and cold was hot - so I almost scalded myself. Freeway noise was horrible. Bed and cleanliness were fine. Location was good.

review.title: DUMP!
review.reviewText: Place was a dump in poor condition. Paint was chipping, grout was falling out, no coffee maker, no tissue, a lot of traffic noise, and the smoke detector was missing! Never again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Nice clean hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was small but very nice clean. For me the most valuable was the cleanliness. The only thing bothered me the noise from the freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: The low price and so close to San Francisco.

review.title: ok for a cheap hotel if only it were cheap
review.reviewText:
All rooms face the freeway which is close and loud if you open the window. Bed is crammed against the air conditioner causing it to cycle on and off frequently and fairly noisily  Room is stuffy without open window or air on. 
Very forceful shower not suitable for kids.  Beds were two doubles, not queens as advertised but reasonably firm and plenty of pillows. Room was clean and TV good. Being in Marin apparently justifies the exorbitant price for what is a bare bones hotel.

review.title: Older hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel but the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.  We wanted a hotel close to the Larkspur ferry and this was fine for the one night we stayed.

review.title: Staying here makes you feel like a loser
review.reviewText: One of the two bedside lamps has the smallest, dimmest light bulb (twisty) that you can find.  The other beside lamp didn't have a bulb in it at all.  I discovered that while putting my hand upside to see if the bulb was loose.  Thank God the lamp  happened to be in the "off" position, because one of my fingers went inside the socket!  The overhead light had two sockets, but only one bulb inside.  Again, very small and dim.  There was one other lamp on a very tiny table pushed into the corner of the tiny room.  The lamp did not have a bulb inside.  The bathroom sink has it's hot water is turned off somewhere upstream of the fixture.  When I turned on the hot water facet, absolutely no water of ANY temperature came out.  I checked the valve under the sink and it was open.  So it's off somewhere else upstream.  The top of the pop-up drain plug was broken off/missing.  So it was impossible to fill up the sink.  I guess even if it wasn't broken, it would have been difficult to fill up the sink, anyway, because the attachment point for the pop-up was missing.  The sink is a pedestal sink, so there is no counter.  There is no toilet paper holder.  The toilet paper sits in a basket on top of the toilet.  No biggie, except that I had to keep removing the top of the toilet to figure out why it wouldn't flush.  The shower is 28" x 30".  Compare that to an old fashioned shower that is 36" x 36". I couldn't direct the shower water to flow directly on body below the waist.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to the restaurant next door. "Marin Joes" (A  knock-off or break-off of "Original Joes.")
review.negativeRemarks: Put bulbs in the sockets. One should be bright enough for reading.  Make the toilet flush.  Have hot water in the sink.  A stopper, too.

review.title: 1 night
review.reviewText: We just night, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. It was fine for what we needed .
review.positiveRemarks: clean room and comfortable bed, close to the places that we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: well it would be a great improvement if they had a spa or something.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to Muir Woods and Stinson Beach, they also have a shopping mall near by and a grocery store.

review.title: Low price tells the story
review.reviewText: Although the room was clean, my overall experiance was a little shaky.  The chair in the room was falling apart, the toilet seat was so loose I cringed when I used it and the shower was down right scary.  I won't be back.  I'm sorry to report there was no coffee maker in the room and I couldn't find any place near by to buy any
review.positiveRemarks: The motel is close to SF and has easy off and on to US101.

review.title: Right next to loud freeway.
review.reviewText: Depressing, unwelcoming desk service (very unhappy desk clerk). Cramped run-down rooms (bed up against window). One room had leaking faucet that could not be turned off (clerk was not surprised or concerned). After complaining and switching rooms twice, we were upgraded to a nicer larger unit which was more comfortable, but the heater was noisy and ineffective, no closet or pegs to hang clothes, a back window on the alley that could not be locked, and still loud freeway noise. The woman who did housekeeping (limited English) was warm, friendly and helpful, and I liked and trusted her. Overall, we saved some money, but it still wasn't cheap; I expected better. Will not return or recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping services (we requested fresh towels daily and nothing else.) Upgraded to a larger room that made our stay bearable. Convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix plumbing, heating, electrical wiring (lamp outlet in same plate as wall switch), closets, security, sound insulation, more welcoming reception.
review.locationRemarks: Easy freeway access. Near Corte Madera Town Center, many shops and cafes.

review.reviewText: Clean and relatively quiet. Some upgrades but nothing fancy. Reasonable value for that area. Very nice front desk person. It fit the bill for what we needed.

So so you got what you pay for
staff was OK
Lacatiin not perfect but not so nesty

review.title: Hotel within 15 min of El Cerrito
review.reviewText: The Drive from hotel into Oakland across the John F. McCarthy Memorial Bridge was very scenic.
review.positiveRemarks: Firm beds and amply hot water
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is limited.  Hotel is right next to highway 101 constant traffic noise. Towels are thin and small.
review.locationRemarks: Marine Joes is right next door and is an excellent restaurant, with a large menu to choose from, superbly prepared food and friendly staff

review.reviewText: ok place for the night,...that's about it...cheapest in the area

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: High price for a room slightly larger than a closet. Left at 7:30 am and the office still want open to get a cup of coffee.

review.title: Close to work.
review.reviewText: I travel for work, the hotel was a  convenient distance to San Francisco, the room was neat & clean, bed was very comfortable, bonus for having microwave and fridge, staff was friendly, only downer was the carpet needed cleaning & kept the closet closed, smelled old. Very quiet place.

review.title: Drab hotel near freeway
review.reviewText: Thotel and its staff is completely devoid of charm. It is located next to the 101 freeway; unless you are dead tired the noise will lkeeep you awake.The room has the amenities you would expect, but does not invite one to spend any time there unless absolutely required by fatigue.

review.title: Noisy, noisy, noisy
review.reviewText: So close to the 101 you could hit a car with a stone from the hotel window. Guests came in all hours of the night clomping up tile steps, talking in the hall, slamming doors. The maids woke us up to clean the room 2 hours before check out. And, we arrived 2 hours after check in time and had to wait 25 minutes for the room to be cleaned.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything except the proximity to the 101 which is the biggest problem.
review.locationRemarks: It's in Marin County 15 minutes north of the Golden Gate Bridge and close to hiking, biking, excellent restaurants and antique shops.

review.title: Terrible room
review.reviewText:
The room was previously a smoking room and was heavily perfumed to cover the smell but still the pillows and bed smelled.  The room was tiny tiny.

Just a really bad experience for my $149 plus tax and fees.

last night i stayed at a travel lodge for less then that and it was great.

needless to say i already booked a room for tonight

Isabelle

review.title: Low quality
review.reviewText:
15 parking place for 15 cars, and there are 18 to 20 rooms. If you arrive after 8pm, you will park on the street. Our room was dark, daytime turn on all light in the room. Three feet from the window there is a wall, air is musty, or burned oil smell from the neighbors restaurant. Coffee is terrible, and there is not neither milk, nor sweetener, only sugar. Cleaning lady is nice, friendly, and helpful, but the receptionists are tired or don't like their job.
We survived the two days, but next time we will slep somewhere else.
Old building, freeway is close, lot of noise.

review.title: Hotel Needs Soundproofing
review.reviewText:
Hotel was pretty much OK. Its next to a freeway, but needs soundproofing. I used earplugs, and was fine -- but I used to hitchhike and sleep in dumpsters, so my tolerance for noise is probably higher than most.

Room is old, but bed was remarkable comfortable. The staff were really pleasant and nice. Bathroom clean, shower was hot so no complaints. Its not a luxury place at all but was convenient for my needs. Parking is a challenge, its located next to a very popular restaurant and finding a space on the property is hard. There is nearby enough street parking so workable. I would stay there again if I needed to, but probably would not seek out the place on purpose.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient for my needs, i was doing business and visiting nursing homes. Price was by far cheapest in area on my stay dates.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby to shopping and resturants. Not a resort hotel. its a good business hotel if you have business in the area and just need a base of operation.

review.title: Nice hotel in a cute little town
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel on the Redwood Freeway. The bed was very comfortable and front desk staff was helpful and polite.Traffic noise was noticeable and a little annoying. The only issue I had with the room was the mold in the bathroom shower. Could have been cleaner. But overall good value for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Bay and attractions there

review.title: NEEDS UPDATING
review.reviewText: Small parking lot. Had a room with a shower no bath. very small room. The desk was half the size of most hotel desks. No coffee pot. No ironing board. Not friendly staff. Bathroom was half the size of most hotel rooms. Would not stay here again. Very uncomfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: close to highway.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses. The front desk personnel. Cleanliness of room.

review.title: Clean but basic.
review.reviewText: Clean room but no coffee making facilities. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Although there was a reoccurring problem with the internet, I had a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience of local stores and very cordial owner.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connections

review.title: Nice hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Although there was a reoccurring problem with the internet, I had a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience of local stores and very cordial owner.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connections

review.title: dirty and freeway traffic noise
review.reviewText:
Hotel is right next to the freeway with no weather stripping or sound proofing around door so the traffic noise was really loud all night. If I had earplugs I could have overlooked how dirty it was and the overpriced rate.
Expedia refunded full amount of rate. They were really helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: sealing the gaps around the door would be a big improvement.

review.title: The motel is CLEAN and without scents!
review.reviewText: We love this motel! NO scents, No perfumes, No cigarette odor! Great bed! We had a quiet room. Will definitely stay here when we're in Marin.
review.positiveRemarks: Next door to Marin Joe's, close to the Corte Madera Mall with easy freeway access.
review.locationRemarks: Mount Tamalpais, Muir Beach, Muir Woods, Corte Madera, Stinson Beach all 10 minutes or less.

review.title: Solid Place for a Quick, One Night Stay
review.reviewText: This is a solid hotel that's located conveniently near the freeway, the mall, and restaurants and is in a safe area. The rooms are clean, there is free wireless internet and the price was right. It's not particularly exciting and I wouldn't recommend this for a multi-stay visit to the area. However, for a quick, one night stay you get a lot of value. I'd stay there again if I were passing through.
review.positiveRemarks: The value. It's priced right for what it offers - a clean, solid place to stay. Best of all, it's located right next door to Marin Joe's restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint was the other guests stood outside and smoked and talked loudly to each other, then got up at 4:00 AM to leave.
review.locationRemarks: Eat at Marin Joes. Continue down the 101 and then turn off on highway 1 and head to Muir Woods.

review.title: works if you just need a place to sleep
review.reviewText: Well located for my needs. Proximity to freeway noise might bother some. great price

review.title: One night too much
review.reviewText: Litty tiny room ...no access to Wi FI . Horrible experience !

review.title: OK and old hotel
review.reviewText: It is a very old hotel. It is by the freeway and noisy although I used earplugs at night and that was OK. The quality of the upkeep is poor but OK since it was the only hotel I could find last minute. I did check for bedbugs and fleas and didn't find any. No air or heater that I could tell. I couldn't find them. Lucky it was warm days. I would not stay there again. But, it was next to Marin Joe's Restaurant which is a great restaurant to go eat at. The smell of the cooking from the restaurant permeated the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Had free WiFi and next to excellent restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: old, run down, by freeway
review.locationRemarks: by the freeway, small parking lot

review.title: Expected More for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was conveniently located, but the condition of our room was terrible. It was supposed to be non-smoking but we could barely get the scent of smoke out with all of the windows open. When we did open the window the screen was broken out of it in a second-story room. Several walls and doors had paint chipping off. There were cobwebs in the closet. The bed was okay but not overly comfortable. The bathroom wasn't super clean either. We spent as little time in our room as possible. For the price we paid we expected more. Next time, we will book earlier so that we can get a decent room at a better hotel for nearly the same price.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoke Scent, Cleanliness (Lack of), Uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: Near good shopping and food, close to Mill Valley & the bay

review.title: Nice roadside motel.
review.reviewText: This is an old roadside motel that has been reasonably cared for. It was not luxurious but I felt safe and the room was clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get on the 101.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of road noise from the 101!

review.title: impossible to find without a GPS, dirty outside
review.reviewText: Impossible to find without a GPS. Rooms were ok, small but had all that was needed. Outside our window, however, soooo much trash and plastic bags hanging off the trees, very disgusting. We couldn't open the windows in one room, and the bathroom door of the other room couldn't close. Hotel right next to the highway, pretty noisy. Staff was a bit clueless and would take a lot of time to answer (they'd go somewhere in the back and disappear). I'd still stay there some other time if the price was cheaper. For the price we paid, I was expecting a lot more.

review.title: Happy, Happy Happy
review.reviewText: Wow, We were very pleased with everything it was a very nice area, located near great shopping ,and dining we were very very happy
review.positiveRemarks: of course the price was great, but the location was the best
review.negativeRemarks: cant think of a thing really
review.locationRemarks: it was right next to marin joe a very nice restaurant, within 1/2 mile of PFchang's and california kitchen and lots of others

review.title: America's WORST Value Inn
review.reviewText: Filthy! shower stall was BLACK WITH MILDEW! sink basin broken, lights didn't work, door locks flimsy, limited parking. No way to reach front desk after midnight. request for a 5:30 am wakeup call... wakeup call came at 1:42 am!!!! I would never recommend this place. The motel 6 a block away was MUCH better!

review.title: Not Recommended
review.reviewText: I guess for the money and the location the hotel serves its purpose. The bed was very old and uncomfortable. The door had a huge gap and if I was alone I would not have felt very safe (plus it was very cold). Actually went to a friends house in the area to take a shower, wasn't very clean.

review.title: Very dirty and loud street noise.
review.reviewText: No frills. Uncomfortable bed. Room stunk, carpet dirty. Toilet would not flush.

review.title: Not going back
review.reviewText: Stayed there three nights. Back to room mid- afternoon of the second day to find no maid service. Front desk stated that maids were gone for the day ... sorry. Shower stall took hours to drain ... not fixed during our stay, and toilet clogged on last morning. T-P holder hanging off wall. Old, run down facility.

review.title: horrible
review.reviewText: no heating. cigarette smell. cigarette burns on the blankets.
